Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice or type B kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black (fired reddish) below; exterior reserved; inscription on interior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic elements and the absence of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces make it impossible to determine whether it came from a kantharos or a chalice. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) have very little decoration as well.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 25.13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1523) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
